metadata.Title: CVE-2019-8355 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in SoX 14.4.2. In xmalloc.h, there is an integeroverflow on the result of multiplication fed into the lsx_valloc macro thatwraps malloc. When the buffer is allocated, it is smaller than expected,leading to a heap-based buffer overflow in channels_start in remix.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8355` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsox-fmt-all - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1
libsox-fmt-alsa - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1
libsox-fmt-ao - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1
libsox-fmt-base - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1
libsox-fmt-mp3 - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1
libsox-fmt-oss - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1
libsox-fmt-pulse - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1
libsox2 - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1
sox - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1').
